intro: Conandron ramondioides var. leucanthus, commonly known as the white-flowered stonecress, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or calcareous soils and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and clustered inflorescences. Its white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in dense clusters, and the plant is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting pollinators.
